title: CPC to abolish 3% discount for fuel distributors from tomorrow
byline: The Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), D.J. Rajakaruna, says that the 3% discount currently granted to fuel distributors will be abolished, with a new payment formula set to take effect from tomorrow (01).

title: Colombo’s inflation down further in February
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has decreased to -4.2% in February 2025, compared to -4% in January 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: USAID workers say goodbye to headquarters as Trump drastically cuts foreign aid
byline: U.S. Agency for International Development workers were allowed to briefly reenter the headquarters in Washington on Thursday to collect their personal belongings and clear out their desks, a day after President Donald Trump’s administration said it was cutting more than 90% of the agency’s aid contracts.

title: Katy Perry, Lauren Sanchez among Blue Origin’s planned all-female crew to space
byline: Pop star Katy Perry and journalists Gayle King and Lauren Sanchez, who is also billionaire Jeff Bezos’ fiancée, are set to blast off into space on a Blue Origin rocket, marking the first all-female flight crew in more than six decades.

title: No price revision in March: Laugfs Gas
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC announced that the company will not revise domestic LP gas prices for the month of March 2025.

title: President AKD arrives in Parliament during budget debate
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament, a short while ago, to participate in the debate on the allocation of the expenditure head for the Ministry of Defence.

title: Era of overthrowing govts through conspiracies and racism is over – President
byline: Delivering a special statement in parliament today, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the incumbent government will not allow terrorism and racism to raise their heads once again in the country.

title: Court orders arrest of ex-IGP Deshabandu and 7 others
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has ordered the arrest of 8 former officers of the Colombo Crimes Division (CCD), including former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon, and to name them as suspects in the shooting incident that took place in front of the W15 Hotel in the Pelena area of Weligama, Matara on December 31, 2023.

title: Sri Lankan Muslims to begin Ramadan fasting on Sunday
byline: The Colombo Grand Mosque has announced that the crescent (new moon) for the month of Ramadan has not been sighted, and that Muslims in Sri Lanka will begin the month of fasting on Sunday, (March 2).

title: No revision in fuel prices for March - CPC
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has issued a statement confirming that there will be no revision of fuel prices for the month of March, 2025.

title: CPC chairman assures no fuel shortage, urges consumers not to panic
byline: The Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has assured the public that there will be no shortage of fuel in the country and therefore urged consumers not to panic.

title: IMF board completes Sri Lanka’s 3rd review, approves $334m tranche
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Friday said its executive board completed the third review under the 48-month Extended Fund Facility (EFF) Arrangement for Sri Lanka, allowing the government to draw SDR 254 million (about US$334 million) to support its economic policies and reforms.

title: Veteran actress Susantha Chandramali passes away
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan actress Susantha Chandramali has passed away at the age of 61 after a prolonged illness.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern, Southern, and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara Eliya, and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: Police open fire on stolen lorry in Kaduwela, suspect arrested
byline: Police officers have opened fire on a lorry that was stolen from the Wattala area and was being driven away, after it failed to comply with orders to stop in Kaduwela.

title: Trump, Zelenskiy clash in extraordinary White House row
byline: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy’s meeting with Donald Trump has ended in disaster, after the two leaders clashed in an extraordinary exchange before the world’s media at the White House over the war with Russia.

title: ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’ murder: Two more suspects arrested
byline: The Colombo Crimes Division (CCD) has arrested two additional suspects in connection with the assassination of Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as Ganemulla Sanjeewa.

title: Yala National Park temporarily closed
byline: The Yala National Park will be closed to visitors from today (01 March) until further notice due to inclement weather conditions, warden of the park, Manoj Vidyaratne said.

title: No fuel shortage in the country - Deputy Minister
byline: Minister of Labour and Deputy Minister of Economic Development, Prof. Anil Jayantha Fernando, has assured that there is no shortage of fuel reserves in the country.

title: CPC chairman explains fuel issue, denies crisis
byline: The new formula to be introduced for fuel distributors will provide them with a higher benefit than the previous 3% discount, according to the Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC), D.J. Rajakaruna.

title: Kurdish militants declare ceasefire in 40-year insurgency in Turkey
byline: Kurdish militants who have waged a 40-year insurgency in Turkey declared a ceasefire on Saturday, two days after their imprisoned leader called for the group to disarm.

title: Microsoft shutting down Skype in May
byline: Microsoft is closing down Skype, the video-calling service it bought for $8.5 billion in 2011, which had helped spark a transformation in how people communicate online.

title: Sri Lanka still at the ‘beginning of the journey’ - Deputy Minister on IMF approving 4th tranche
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma says that given the situation the country was in, the IMF Executive Board approving the fourth tranche of the bailout package is an important milestone.

title: Tax on service exports cut to 15% from 50% agreed on by previous govt - Dy Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma says that the incumbent government’s approach to the IMF-supported economic reform program is to prioritize on the people’s needs as the first item.

title: 33 injured in bus-lorry collision at Muthur
byline: A bus carrying pilgrims from Minuwangoda to Seruwawila has reportedly collided with a lorry in Muthur, resulting in injuries to 33 persons including 18 females.

title: Ranil meets Indian PM Modi in New Delhi
byline: The Prime Minister of India Shri Narendra Modi has met the former President of Sri Lanka, Ranil Wickremesinghe at the NXT Conclave in New Delhi today (01).

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meterology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Eastern, Southern and Uva provinces and in Matale, Nuwara-Eliya and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: Party leaders agree to establish seven Sectoral Oversight Committees
byline: The Secretary-General of Parliament, Mrs. Kushani Rohanadeera, stated that consensus was reached during the meeting of the Committee on Parliamentary Business to establish seven Sectoral Oversight Committees under the Tenth Parliament, with three Committee Chairmanships allocated to the Opposition and four to the government.

title: Foreign travel ban on former IGP Deshabandu
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has imposed an overseas travel ban on former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Tax on service exports cut to 15% from 30% agreed on by previous govt - Dy Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma says that the incumbent government’s approach to the IMF-supported economic reform program is to prioritize on the people’s needs as the first item.

title: Auction of luxury vehicle of President’s Office begins
byline: The auction for 14 luxury vehicles belonged to the President’s Office, six decommissioned vehicles and various spare parts was held on Friday (Feb 28), according to the President’s Media Division (PMD).

title: European leaders back Zelensky after Trump clash
byline: European leaders have rallied behind Volodymyr Zelensky after Donald Trump’s furious exchange with the Ukrainian president in the White House.
